revisions.revision: added plugins, named some structs, and stuff
added spawn time for objects placement and vehicle spawn effects
Regenerated to bring back deleted sections.

bit.name: Don't Strip Pathfinding
bit.tooltip: always leave pathfinding in, even for a multiplayer scenario

bit.name: Big Vehicle Use Center Point For Light Sampling

tagblock.name: Structure BSPs

enum32.name: Size Class
enum32.tooltip: Tells lightmapper desired res for structure bitmaps. Numbers in parenthesis are final sizes after compression

float32.name: Structure Vertex Sink
float32.tooltip: this is the most that we can sink a soft surface link snow in the structure_bsp via vertex painting.

bit.name: Ray Trace Adjacent Bsps On Sky Hits
Lightmaps Final Gather Ignores Backfacing Hits
Lightmaps Use More Samples For Large Sky Lights
Lightmaps Use More Precise Extended Gathering (Incredibly Slow)
Not A Normally Playable Space In An MP Map (Check This On Shared Bsps)

int16.name: Default Instance Fade Start Pixels
int16.tooltip: >end, pixel size we start stippling out. code default 36

int16.name: Default Instance Fade End Pixels
int16.tooltip: <start, pixel size where we no longer render. code default 30

tagblock.comment: Describes which other bsps are physical 'clones' of this bsp This is used to determine how to attach 'position-only' elements, like decorators, to the bsps: Each clone gets a separate copy of decorators that are in both. Non-cloned bsps cannot split decorators this way - the decorator will be given to the lowest numbered bsp

tagblock.name: Cluster Potentially Visible Sets Doors Closed
Room Door Portal Encoded Potentially Audible Sets
Game Portal To Door Occluder Mapping
Scenery
tagblock.comment: This block allows you to "pose" this object's nodes. Used normally for dead bodies. The orientations block has an entry for each checked node flag, skipping unchecked ones. The blocks labeled [Readable] are modified to make reading/editing the values easier, but as a result the entry counts will be innaccurate, going too far may result in editing the wrong data. DO NOT USE THE BLOCK REALLOCATOR ON THE [READABLE] BLOCKS!

int16.name: Parent Object Name Index
int16.tooltip: if an object with this name exists, we attach to it as a child

int16.name: Parent Object Index
int16.tooltip: if an object with this name exists, we attach to it as a child

int32.name: Maximum Allowed
int32.tooltip: if this is <= 0, these are 'unlimited' (up to a reasonable code-defined maximum)

int16.name: Primary Rounds Loaded
int16.tooltip: -1 = weapon default

int16.name: Primary Rounds Total
int16.tooltip: -1 = weapon default

int16.name: Secondary Rounds Loaded
int16.tooltip: -1 = weapon default

int16.name: Secondary Rounds Total
int16.tooltip: -1 = weapon default

tagblock.name: Trigger Volumes
tagblock.comment: the name of the trigger volume specifies what kind of volume it is: 'zone_set:' 'begin_zone_set:' 'kill' 'playerkill' for player only kill volume 'safe_zone' 'location_' 'unsafe_spawn' append ':*' to zone set names to allow vehicles to teleport along with their players.

plugin.comment: You can use the following to override multiplayer global spawn influencers for the scenario

int16.name: Normal Difficulty Count
int16.tooltip: initial number of actors on normal difficulty

float32.name: Delay
float32.tooltip: how long the AI should pause at this point

float32.name: Angle
float32.tooltip: the angle-from-forward that the AI can pick at this point

int16.name: Swarm Count
int16.tooltip: number of cretures in swarm if a swarm is spawned at this location

float32.name: Initial Movement Distance
float32.tooltip: before doing anything else, the actor will travel the given distance in its forward direction

float32.name: Delay
float32.tooltip: how long the AI should pause at this point

float32.name: Angle
float32.tooltip: the angle-from-forward that the AI can pick at this point

option.name: If All Players In Trigger Volume
Player Shot More Than X Seconds Ago

tagRef.name: Inside Cluster Sound
tagRef.tooltip: play only when player is inside cluster.

bit.name: Use Adjacent Cluster As Portal Scale
Use Adjacent Cluster As Exterior Scale

float32.name: Forced Exposure
float32.tooltip: the target exposure (ONLY USED WHEN FORCE EXPOSURE IS CHECKED)

float32.name: Forced Auto-Exposure Screen Brightness
float32.tooltip: how bright you want the screen to be (ONLY USED WHEN FORCE AUTO EXPOSURE IS CHECKED)

tagblock.name: Spawn Data
tagblock.comment: Non-zero values here overload what appears in multiplayer_globals

tagblock.name: Static Respawn Zones
tagblock.comment: Lower and upper heights can be left at zero, in which case they use the defaults. Leaving relevant teams empty means all teams, leaving all games empty means all games

tagblock.name: Static Initial Spawn Zones
tagblock.comment: Lower and upper heights can be left at zero, in which case they use the defaults. Leaving relevant teams empty means all teams, leaving all games empty means all games.

tagblock.name: Crates
tagblock.comment: This block allows you to "pose" this object's nodes. Used normally for dead bodies. The orientations block has an entry for each checked node flag, skipping unchecked ones. The blocks labeled [Readable] are modified to make reading/editing the values easier, but as a result the entry counts will be innaccurate, going too far may result in editing the wrong data. DO NOT USE THE BLOCK REALLOCATOR ON THE [READABLE] BLOCKS!

int16.name: Parent Object Name Index
int16.tooltip: if an object with this name exists, we attach to it as a child

int16.name: Parent Object Index
int16.tooltip: if an object with this name exists, we attach to it as a child

float32.name: Ecology Margin
float32.tooltip: distance from ecology boundary that creature begins to be repulsed

float32.name: Weight
float32.tooltip: probability of producing at this source

rangef.name: Production Frequency Bounds
rangef.tooltip: How frequently boids are produced at one of the sources (limited by the max boid count)

float32.name: Source Scale To 0 Radius
float32.tooltip: Distance from a source at which the creature scales to full size

float32.name: Sink Scale To 0 Radius
float32.tooltip: Distance from a sink at which the creature begins to scale to zero

tagblock.name: Designer Zones
tagblock.comment: This block is essentially leftover import data and is only useful as a reference to where something is loaded. Modifying anything in this block won't change anything.

float32.name: Time
float32.tooltip: if you finish in under this time you get the following bonus
